Reviews.Title: “decaying motel would be a more accurate description of the Orchard Parade!”
Reviews.Author: midnightblue2020
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Parade hotel was shockingly awful - overpriced and really not worth the room rate or 3.5/4 star rating it seemed to boast. I was given a deluxe room - supposedly one of the best - and was looking forward to my room given the somewhat grand hotel entrance. On entering the room, I can only describe my reaction as one of shock and disbelief - the sofa upholstery had dark stains on it, the carpet was old and shabby and the tv did not work. The bathroom was a health and safety hazard - there was a gaping hole in the wall with exposed plumbing and pipes, and hairs in the washbasin. The internet crashed at least 5 times, and each time you had to pay for a further 15 minutes at a high cost. The check-in process also took 45 minutes - far too long particularly after a long journey. At night the lobby of the hotel was full of what can only be described as escort ladies. I checked out of the hotel the following morning - 4 days earlier than I had initially anticipated, and wasnt surprised to see other guests at the concierge also complaining miserably about the room conditions. All in all a dreadful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mdpath
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days and 2 nights in this hotel. We had a wonderful time as it is near the restaurants and malls. The hotel employees were very very helpful and accomodating. Our bathroom had a small bath tub and the sink was clogged during our first day. But then again, we would stay in the hotel on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel on a hot spot.”
Reviews.Author: normandic
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Parade hotel is a hotel on a very nice location if you want to visit Orchard Road. There are plenty restaurants and shop's on walking distance of the hotel. The hotel itself seems a bit in decay and could use some refreshment. The battery of my safe was not working, and when i tried to call the reception i found out that the phone was not working. I had to go down to the reception but no serviced came, so i had to go down again. The seams in the showers were mouldy and the decoration of my room was a bit worn out. I would describe the rooms as very average. I only had to stay there for one night and for me the location was more important than the quality of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Its getting better with age!”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaGilbert
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times over the past ten years or so and have to stay a vast improvement is evident throughout the hotel over the last 3 to 4 years. The lobby, reception and bedrooms have received a facelift. It is also obvious that the staff seem to be enjoying the changes in the Hotel, as they seem to take alot more pride in their job and they are much more friendlier than before. The rooms I've stayed in where very comfortable, with a great big comfy bed and big LCD TV. Breakfast buffet has a good variety of offerings. The location of the hotel is great, just at the top of Orchard Road. The hotel has a good pool area and gym, which I again noticed has been recently updated. I will definitely be back not just for the hotel and staff but also so I can keep up with the changes

Reviews.Title: “awesome place for leisure”
Reviews.Author: sachinrawal
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard room in this hotel from 15days before our journey. This hotel is located at main orchard road which is the heart of singapore. It's lobby is awesome and rooms are well neat and clean. The room service was also good. they offer multiple delicious cuisines also. The reception staff is very co-operative. If you have some valuables you may keep at reception in safe custody which I Feel best part of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Prepoerty , Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: prashant1272
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel for 7 days inJan2009. Located at OrchardParade Hotel and opp to this hotel there is a shoping malls and which becomes very crowded in night !!!! So if guys your are a game for it ,please plan for orchard parade

Reviews.Title: “It was fine for us”
Reviews.Author: lbalaw
Reviews.Content: We were three guys looking for one room for one night and this fit our needs. Location was paramount for one day and the in house travel agency quickly booked us an inexpensive and good day tour. The room was ok for a night as almost anything would be for three guys. We never ate at any of the restaurants but found the hotel service generally to be very good. Given everything ,including cost , and Singapore is pricy, it was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Be wary if you are gay otherwise good”
Reviews.Author: ZacGlenn
Reviews.Content: Like other Far East hotels, there seems to be a problem with reception staff allowing gay couple to share a bed. Despite a specific booking for a double bed, reception staff were unable to locate one for us. There was one, but when they reallised it was for 2 older guys, the smiles dropped, a nasty comment in Malay to another staff member was heard and we were given an "appropriate" twin room. (My partner is fluent in Malay) We had paid for 3 nights amd knew the hotel from previous stays so decided to stay. Like the Albert Court, Its a nice comfortable hotel good rooms clean and all of that. Day 2 at 8:30 am they wanted to clean the room, we had checked in at 10 pm the night before. Day 3 No room cleaning..... a call from housekeeping at 7:30 pm to ask when could they clean and make up the room. Too late Too early, Too bad. Such a shame. We did enjoy staying here but will need to find something else for our next visit to Singapore. Management please note, you need to train staff to treat everyone with respect and dignity.

Reviews.Title: “Found it a bit expensive for value, but isn´t all of Singapore like this?”
Reviews.Author: Vagabond_World
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place, conveniently located. I did´nt stay for breakfast, I had a look around and thought: "this is not for me", they on ly have big chinese restaurante tables, which might be okay for lunch, but not for breakfast, the whole thing is a bit untidy. The other restuarants below are okay, although also not cheap, and I ended up having breakfast at Starbucks. I would look around to stay in a better value for money place next time. The room was a bit small, but the TV was okay, although the tv signal reception was dodgy at best.

Reviews.Title: “Orchard Parade, truly a great experience”
Reviews.Author: jsjb100
Reviews.Content: While I have stayed at the Orchard Parade hotel many times over the last 10 years, my 2009 experience was really an excellent example of professionalism and hospitality. Let me start first with the bellmen/doormen. These people are excellent, on the ball, make you feel so welcomed and honestly, even though it was well over a year between visits for me, they actually addressed me by name. Front desk staff is friendly, smiling and helpful. I signed up online and was put in an annex room, but had some issues with the internet. Spoke to the front desk who immediately talked to the Assistant to the Hotel Manager, Ms. Ang. This professional woman could not have done more to remedy the situation. I got upgraded to a beautiful room, bellmen moved all the things from one room to another, and had the great opportunity to interact with Ms. Ang and Mr. Willis, the manager. These people could not have been nicer or more professional. My stay was almost 2 weeks. The OP is well located on Orchard Road, has my favorite starbucks in the world in front of it (people watching is the best there) laundry facility, pool, nice breakfast, great housekeepers (aunties who are just terrific and do a great job). I have stayed at many hotels in the orchard road and Quay area....and there is none of those large chains that I would pick over the OP. This hotel is an example of "if you have any problem, talk to the front desk and management has empowered them to make it right." Bravo....my only suggestion to the Far East company...let the employees wear something other than those "wool" suits...they are soooo hot for the climate in Singapore, hehe. But really, the OP is a real gem,don't miss out on it.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only thing...and no comment for the rest...”
Reviews.Author: ElectricBunny
Reviews.Content: ok...my review is simple 1 / no HOT water supply after 12 midnight....till the morning ( I experienced the same thing through out my 3D4N stay...the water become barely warm after midnight till the morning) 2 / I paid for a Deluxe room with QUEEN SIZE bed but ended up they give me a room with two single beds putting next to each others...and I almost drop into the gap in between in the middle of the night... 3/ Internet is too expensive...consider there are soooo many hotels offering free wifi to their guest...

Reviews.Title: “A Different Perspective”
Reviews.Author: Lecturer-on-Tour
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews for the Orchard Parade prior to leaving the UK and was apprehensive. My own experiences ... The room was very clean and linen was changed daily; the laundry service was excellent. Breakfast was very good and the service provided was first class. Staff refereed to me by name and remembered what I drank - I liked this personal touch; staff were more than willing to share the best places to visit and went out of their way to provide maps/directions. Staff in reception were warm and welcoming and very patient - particularly as I wiped the key code three times. Check-out was prompt and I was even provided with a weigh-in service for my cases.

Reviews.Title: “I should have ignored the reviews”
Reviews.Author: Jeannius24
Reviews.Content: Having arranged a 16 night holiday at the Orchard Park, I was concerned with some of the reviews on this site, but decided to go ahead anyway. They couldn't have been more wrong. First impressions, a stylish reception area with good service and attention to detail, greeted with a warm friendly smile by the concierge and reception staff. Nice room, but we did have one over looking Orchard Road, I believe there are a few that don't so just be aware when booking. Also, the hotel itself has no catering facilities, the various restaurants are privately owned and run, a Steak House, Italian, Japanese, Sinapore and Chinese restaurants, The Chinese being on the 1st floor and where breakfast is served, in Singapore it gets a great write up, but it may not be to everyone's taste, it did lack atmosphere, more like a school canteen, could do with more intimate small tables and lower lighting. Because most tables are larger, you may be asked to share your breakfast table with complete strangers, which didn't suit us, so we waited. However, there are some good places for breakfast just a few minutes away, amonst them, Borders. The room was cleaned everyday, the staff friendly and helpful. The pool area was a little disappointing as the 'so called pool bar' wasn't open the entire time we were there. Try out the tailor on the ground floor, geZarino tailors, excellent service, fine tailoring. Lastly, don't go there with preconceived western ideas, this is a Far Eastern Country and you should embrace their culture and ways, 'When in Rome'. If you can't adapt don't go. The main bar could do with some fresh new ideas, it was also lacking atmosphere, but the staff and service was great.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GaryKarle
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was very comfortable and clean. The Orchard Parade is located on the edge of the Central Business District and it is just a 2 block walk to the nearest subway station. There are numerous restaurants located around the hotel. I will be returning to the Orchard Parade!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but nice”
Reviews.Author: Chingapore
Reviews.Content: Spent a week starting @ xmas 2009 @ Orchard Parade. The hotel is quite old but in pretty good condition. We had a clean room with a tv & aircon. They were kind enough to check us in early because a room was available. The toilet had a sort of door in the wall above the toilet, & it had no lock - it opened into the plumbing area. It was really creepy so we stuck pieces of paper in the crack between the strange door and the wall to keep it closed. The toilet seat was cracked and resulted in a painful laceration. One complimentary toothbrush was provided for the 2 of us... The cupboards were quite good and included a safe. There was also a minibar available. it was a bit disappointing that the balcony door could not be opened. In terms of service, a 10% service fee is charged over your daily room rate. this is not included on the website so you think the hotel is cheaper than others int he area and it is not. Even the invoice that is sent to you when you book, does not include this. The porters and doormen are quite strange. They will look on as you struggle with your luggage and do nothing to assist. They also stand at the doors & do not open them for you. This is all quite annoying when you see a SERVICE CHARGE of 10% per day & you know that you have not received any good service.

Reviews.Title: “Imperfect, but not a disaster”
Reviews.Author: HappyBelly
Reviews.Content: Likes: 2 blocks from the MRT, very close to shopping. Even if you're not a shopper, close to a ton of food. Room was decent. Very decent breakfast buffet with a lot of choices. Dislikes; Service wasn't that great. Check-in took a long time, and when I called down for a wake-up call, no one answered. This happened repeatedly, Annoying, but bearable. Also, this place has low-flush toilets, and thin walls.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is in a Shopper's paradise”
Reviews.Author: gudiya99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on Orchard Road, the best place to shop in Singapore. The room was also very spacious. There are great places to eat just outside the hotel. The metro station was just a walking distance away. It is ver startegically located.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for weekend special”
Reviews.Author: Polarisie
Reviews.Content: Stayed in OP for 4 nights in total. Originally booked for the cheaper weekend and extended it to another 2 weekdays. The front desk were especially polite & helpful. Got upgraded to a business suite since we did early checked-in & our room was not ready yet. Very spacious room with a balcony facing Orchard road. The housekeeping had been helpful too as we did not ask for daily housekeeping but they still check if we need additional towels / amenities..

Reviews.Title: “Difficult To Deal With - Stay Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: sophPerth
Reviews.Content: I called the hotel direct to ensure a walk in shower for my disable mother and elderly father then booked a family suite on their website. We arrived 6am so we booked the previous night to ensure checkin. We were told no walk in showers available but by the 3rd room offered and alot of argueing and energy dispersed after no sleep, mysteriously a family suite with walk in shower appeared out of thin air ! We were told breakfast was $15 then that was an error it was $20 when getting our coupons we were told it was $28 then when asking if breakfast was included with the family suite we were told it was $32. Breakfast very poor compared to other singapore hotels. Do not sit on the end of the bed as they have wheels and they roll. The TV was not working it took 2 phone calls and 24 hrs later to fix. We had 2 vanity units one was blocked, the bath tub can not be used as the plumbing was not fitted and water went everywhere. No customer service offered, attitude problems by staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hate it, hated it, will always hate it”
Reviews.Author: travellinglight101
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel during the F1 time which is understandably one of the busiest time for the hotel. However, the staff instead of being helpful and cordial was rude, annoying and made it seem like they were doing us a favor by letting us stay there. On reaching early the lady behind the reception informed us curtly that we were early and we 'should come back after 4 hours'. Having just landed in a foreign country with 5 pieces of luggage between the three of us, coming 'back after 4 hours' seemed very not plausible. To add to this the bathroom was dirty with hair all over the place, the shower handle was missing and was substituted by a nail, the window didn’t close so the AC was not effective and the extra bed was meant only for a 10 year old (at 5'4 my feet hung off the bed the whole time i was there). Even though i communicated to the hotel staff that i was not happy with the room i was given a curt 'we already gave you an early check in and we will upgrade you as per availability'. They did offer to change our room on the last day of our stay but we declined. All in all i didn’t like this hotel at all. it was just a waste of money

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service, decently located, fast response to fixing air con”
Reviews.Author: LondonCake
Reviews.Content: All in all, I am generally happy with this hotel. check in was easy and friendly. upgraded free of charge. my room's air conditioner didnt seem to be working - luckily there is no direct sunlight heating up the room, and they sent someone within 1 minute to start fixing it. My only complaint, which is more taste based, is that it is rather dark inside the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of rooms with a view of a wall!”
Reviews.Author: brooksymalaysia
Reviews.Content: I recently booked 2 interconnecting rooms at this hotel, direct. When we turned up I asked if it was on the pool side, as looking at trip advisor before, this was stated as being the quieter side. i was told there were no interconnecting rooms pool side, but not to worry, our room was quiet. When we got there, was quite happy with room, till, my husband opened the curtain...to find a brick wall not 2 feet from the window!! In our childrens room it was a little better, an 'inside' view!! We were in room 400, so presume all the way up and down are the same. Also up to rooms 06 had these wonderful views. On complaining was offered alternate rooms, on noisy side. we declined, but asked for a rate reduction. This they would not give, but offered us an up-grade to a family suite next time...no thank you. The pool area was also dissapointing, as you could only get food/beverage through telephoning reception.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: boomsnap
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure if it was just the recession, but the price for the room was incredible value for the services offered. It's right slap bang on orchard road and the room I had was recently refurbished. It was also quiet, clean and spacious. The decor isn't beautiful, but it is functional and serves it's purposes. It also has a good sized swimming pool. The downstairs communal parts aren't all that swish, but then you've got the St. Regis round the corner if you crave luxury. And of course there are then all the restaurants along Orchard. I also found the staff very helpful. For Singapore this is exceptional value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: xerobasher
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in 2006 for a stop-over before going to Thailand. So I got a pretty good stop-over deal of course and was looking very forward to the hotel, since the location is awesome. Well, I will never forget what I've experienced there. They put me in a tiny and not very clean room. I had a window...but SUPRISE, the window was nailed shut with a board in front of it. I am not joking. Between the window and board were cigarette butts. Since I was on a very tight schedule for sightseeing I did not complain a the reception which, of course, I should have done. First night was okay. On the second day no one made up my room. When I complained in the evening they told me that they cannot make up my room now anymore. I didn't get it; I left early in the morning. But the worst was yet to come. The second night was terrible. I got a room RIGHT NEXT to a club/disco. It was so unbelieveable loud, you can't imagine it if you haven't stayed there. There was NO way I could get any sleep until 4 in the morning. Incredible. Since I had to leave in the morning I didn't want to complain at the reception, they wouldn't have given me another room anyway. Most probably the worst hotel I've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific, value for money and comfy!”
Reviews.Author: Maiel
Reviews.Content: My sister and I chose this hotel because of its good reviews and also its affordability. The hotel is situated at the quiet side of Orchard road but still in very good accesibility to the malls since most of the malls are within 10 minutes walking distance. The front desk was very accomodating, even the housekeeping team - given our requests for additional toiletries and the like. We didn't try the restaurants though, but were impressed with the hotel's pool that it was enough reason for us to come back with our spouses and young children. Even the person handling the tours was superbly accommodating and we are truly impressed with the way they handle our many queries. When in singapore, this hotel will always be at the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Huge family room, super location”
Reviews.Author: CooloolaKate
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family room at the Orchard parade hotel for 8 nights from the 1st of July to the 9th of July. The room is HUGE. It holds one king size bed and 2 larger than average single beds. The beds are very comfortable, no springs sticking in you at this hotel and no blankets.. all beds have soft duvets, WONDERFUL. We slept incredibly well. The bathroom is extremely large with daily re-stocking of shampoos, bath gel, toothbrushes, tissues, loo rolls and shower caps. Housekeeping is excellent. Super big shower. Bathroom could do with a larger extractor fan. The family room also a lounge area that has a two seater couch, single armchair and a dining room table and 4 chairs. There is a tv in the bedroom area and another in the lounge area. Free daily newspaper delivered to the room and hung outside on the door knob.There is a more than ample amount of cupboards and drawers and a personal safe. Our room faced Orchard Road and had a balcony which we enjoyed. There is a big pool with trellis shaded loungers, pool towels and change rooms on the sixth floor. Also a laundry and extremely nice gym on the same floor. I think the drawcard to this hotel is it's location. Directly opposite the hotel is the sheltered bus stop for buses to all the major attractions eg. Zoo, Night Safari, Sentosa, open top bus tours to Chinatown, Little India etc. It is so easy and cheap to get around. Cabs come past the hotel foyer every couple of minutes. The botanical gardens is an easy walking distance away and a must to visit. The best shopping centres can be walked to. There is a steak house, coffee shop and Italian restuarant directly under the hotel, as well as other restuarants that we didn't get time to try out on the ground and first floor and numerous takeaways, pharmacies and food stores (a great deli just around the corner with well priced Aussie wine! We got tired of restuarant food and it was great to grab a ready made fresh salad tub, rolls, cold meats and cheeses!) within a couple of hundred metres. We really had a fantastic stay and would highly recommend this hotel as we had a super room with great views. The staff were all friendly and polite and a late checkout (extra $70) was easily arranged. I would definitely stay in this hotel again and would request a family room again (facing Orchard Road) as it was more than big enough for my husband and I and our 11 year old daughter and 13 year old son.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Gnrtravellers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Orchard Parade Hotel for 3 nights this week. We were pleasantly surprised as the hotel is more modern than it looks from the exterior. We recommend this hotel for anyone looking at a stay within walking distance to the major shopping area of Orchard Road. Staff – friendly and helpful. Location – perfect! Brilliant location, on the start of Orchard Road, close to the Seven Eleven, Starbucks, Hard Rock Cafe and MRT (5 minutes walk). Rooms – clean and spacious; however drainage in shower and sink very slow (water takes ages to go down, we had to pull out the stopper to quicken the process!). Limited choice of television channels. Breakfast – very simple buffet breakfast, not much choice, but at least they have an Egg Station; no cut fruit, only apples and oranges available. Price – slightly overpriced, but I guess you’re paying for the location. Internet – very high charges (over SGD 3 for 15 minutes). Club Rooms have free broadband access, as does the Club Lounge. Hotel should give free internet access. Swimming pool – located on the 6th floor of the hotel; decently sized; no poolside restaurant, so drinks have to be ordered from Starbucks, etc., and are thus highly priced. We checked into a Club Room for our 3rd night in Singapore. The room is slightly larger than the Superior Room, however the large King bed takes up more area, negating the larger space. The bathroom in the Club Room is the same size as the one in the Superior Room. No extra amenities in the Club Room; however mini bar was free here and the room rate included 2 pieces of laundry per day. Breakfast for the Club Rooms is served on the 17th floor, in the Club Lounge; fruit is cut and cleaned and decent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveller2009India
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is the USP. Rooms have been renovated recently, so remember to ask for a new room. Good restaurants all around. Breakfast is just ok - nothing special. Room is equipped with all that a tourist would need.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rsmoh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Orchard Parade for 3 nights on our way back to London from Melbourne. I booked this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. Upon check-in we were upgraded to a better room as our room had been taken. The rooms were spacious and the bed was very comfortable. The staff were very helpful and friendly. We had a few problems with the drain in the bathtub and they moved us to another room straight away. The location is perfect for walking on Orchard Rd and for taking the metro. Taxis are cheap in Singapore so it was easy to get around. The breakfast was very good, with lots of variety. We would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Mupple
Reviews.Content: Well located for shopping on Orchard Road, Rooms are a bit tired and a little pokey but staff are efficient, friendly, attentive and good at anticipating requirements. Not the brightest or airiest hotel in terms of decor. Nice outdoor pool of good size, but gym is rather underequipped and outdated compared to other hotels in the class. Only ate breakfast here (average) so can't comment on the several restaurants in the place. Would come here again for business, but probably wouldn't choose it for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating stuff”
Reviews.Author: Mukesh550
Reviews.Content: I had booked three rooms for me, my kids and my parents. When I reached the hotel a total chaos was there too many people around Have to wait for 15 minutes to make myself hear. The staff was rude & arrogant. They were offering three rooms on three different floors. My kids are of 7,8 & 9 of age. I have to request them again nd againg for interconnected rooms but of no use. I have to live in distant rooms. More over at the breakfast buffet one of their cook hotly argued with me for a Indian dish. All my fault was that I have told him that its not the name of the dish which u have written its something else . He almost started a fight with me dat he is a cook and he knows better that any one. A frustrating experience. I will give all orchard group a skip next time whenever I visit any where in the world. They people think that they are out of the world and having a superiority complex. God bless them

Reviews.Title: “Good location and quiet too”
Reviews.Author: MrCushtie
Reviews.Content: I didn't have a very deep experience of the Orchard Parade, because I arrived in Singapore at midnight, got to the hotel at 12.30, and left five minutes later to go drinking in Clarke Quay. When I got back I slept until 3pm, and then went back out again, so I didn't leave myself much opportunity to avail myself of the hotel's amenities. On the other hand, the Orchard Parade is on Orchard Road, the main street for most goings-on in Singapore, and I managed to sleep until 3pm, so the soundproofing and the comfort of the bed must be pretty good. Got back the next night even later, up and out by 12. No complaints. The times that I did see the staff (while checking in and out, and in the lift on the way to and from my room) they were incredibly friendly and cheerful - much more than I would be disposed to be at stupid-o'clock in the morning. Downsides - the shower takes a while to heat up. No big issue. Also, taxi drivers get confused when you tell them Tanglin Road - tell them the Orchard Parade on Orchard Road and you seem more likely to be deposited in the right place, rather than have to walk half a mile home on Saturday night when they've put you *somewhere* on Tanglin Road.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Tarun71
Reviews.Content: Its a very well located hotel and has very warm and nice service. Its good for people with families. The only disadvantage is that you need to walk a bit to get to the centre of Orchard Road which gets a bit much when you have a little kid who gets tired midway! Would definitely recommend a stroller to all travellers with kids under five. The upside is that its right next to Toys R Us!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware the disco nearby!”
Reviews.Author: markCapeTown
Reviews.Content: We were allocated the ominous room number of 911 and my wifes superstitious joking unfortunately bore out. Firstly the hotel - the rooms are in serious need of a refurb. they may have been nice when the place opened, but now look dated - particularly the bathroom, which is very tired. Breakfasts were the worst we had on our trip - little options, no prepared fresh fruit, no local options - pretty poor really in a major city. However the worst was to come - on getting back to our room the first night we were met with the loudest music I have ever experienced in a hotel bedroom - thumping disco/dance music. There was also a large airconditioning extract somewhere close as that was also pretty loud. The first night (a sunday) we got some sleep around 3am. The next night I raised the matter with the front desk who offered to move us to another room, but as we were only staying two nights I said not to bother - big mistake - the music went on to 6am - we couldn't sleep at all. Next morning I visited reception for a little chat. They acknowleged they had a problem, and said that they were trying to sort out the matter with the neighbouring disco - who had agreed to stop the music at 2am!! They did agree to give us use of the room until our pick up at 11pm so that we could get a little sleep in the afternoon - but to me it is a disgrace that they are selling the rooms facing the disco - and we booked in March 2008. If you do decide to stay at this hotel - firstly check to see if they have sorted out the problem, and secondly insist on an even numbered room facing inwards towards the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfactory, no-dissapointment hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheEuge
Reviews.Content: We booked our room at The Orchard Parade Hotel for our stay last Oct 18-21, 2008. We paid 180SGD/night (110 USD), inclusive of all taxes and charges. For this price, I would say that we got a good bargain given that the hotel was in a good location and had very likeable facilities. This hotel has a good arrival, it has a big facade, and immediately tells you that you are going to have a good stay. A bellhop cheerfully collected our luggage as we checked in in less than 15 mins. It was 11am at the time but the receptionist gave us our rooms right away without early check-in charges. The hotel's configuration is quite unique. We had to negotiate about 7 turns along the corridors since our room was quite far from the elevator. In our excitement to walk around Orchard, this is something we can easily forgive. Our room was a decent Superior room. It had a decent amount of space (just enough), right amount of furnishings and amenities (a sofa and side table, TV, bar, internet, office desk). It has a walk-in closet where the luggage counter is integrated. The bathroom was clean, had a bathtub, hot shower and toiletries. I coudln't find anything that I didn't like. The bed was good, wasn't hard or soft, it was just right. The bedsheets and pillocases felt good on the skin. We had a good night's rest every night. We also used the Internet (7SGD for 30 mins) just to check on e-mail, not bad at all. We also received a daily copy of the Straits Times, good for waiting while the spouse was int he bathroom. We didn't get the chance to try out the other facilities (swimming pool, bar, restaurants), since we just used the room for sleeping and showering. But this is a great-value hotel for this price! It met our minimum requirements, decent staff, good facilities (not spectacular, but good enough), and for that price, it's worth considering for a future stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small bathroom”
Reviews.Author: dopus
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Singapore after staying few days in this hotel.The first days we stayed in a big room on the 4th floor.The personal was very helpfull and friendly.It was very big and the bed was great.It was clean and the bathroom was huge.There were some molding spots around the washing table and in the shower.After returning from KL we got a suite on the 17 floor.The reception was fantastic.The room was horrible.The bathroom was tiny,due to a set of wooden doors that didn't close good .They should get rid of the shower courtains they look unclean.The airconditining was so cold that we both got the flu.The breakfast was superb and in the evenings there were delicious snacks and drinks for free.I would say that the service was perfect but the rooms need to be upgraded if they want to keep on charging such a high rates.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Shrutinaik Posted by a Cleartrip traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a fabulous location with incredible service , it was so lovely that it was hard to drag ourselves away from the hotel to go and shop ....

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is average”
Reviews.Author: Zacharymia
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel for business. Breakfast was horrible for each of my seven day trip. Room service was ok and there are only 4 English speaking channels on the TV and the rest do not come in because of bad recption. The rooms were nice and service was ok. What was good was the location. It is close to all the shopping on Orchard Rd. and there is plenty of things to do around the area. No spa in hotel, which was a disappointment. I would look for another hotel when I go back to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: RainmanMumbai
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research we finally settled for the Orchard Parade for our family holiday to Singapore. It's a good hotel with a great location, however, NOT for families. We were given 2 rooms on different floors, because - BEWARE - Kids are not allowed on some floors!! Checking -in took ages, the staff at the reception was un-interested and pre-occupied. They kept repeating the problem about the hotel being full, rather than try and solve the problem. Check-out was an even longer process. I'll say again, it's a good hotel with a great location. Rooms are fine and clean. But the reception staff really need a lesson in courtesy and politeness. Weren't they taught how to smile at resident guests? More of a hotel for business people. If you're staying longer, go to the Lanson Place Serviced Apts instead.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable, for the wrong reasons!”
Reviews.Author: Supercalikirasexy
Reviews.Content: Booked a family suite for my bday get together through phone booking. SPACIOUS. and thats that. yes it WAS BIG, HUGE, SPACIOUS, i could roll ard 20 times or play hide n seek with my partner but thats all that is nice abt it. whole hotel needs upgrading or new refurbishments. the front desk ppl seemed uninterested to check me in, appeared busy and had issues with her fellow colleague hence not smiling. (i know all this bcuz i was standing at the frontdesk asking to be checked in before anyone approached me for a good 10 mins. and 10 mins is a long time) all this could probably be becuz im a local. not a tourist. so they rather prioritize the tourists bcuz the tourists are future advocators of the hotel to help spread the word abt the hotel worldwide. the corridors are seriously eerie. so silent that i could HEAR the silence. me and friends experienced some eerie stuffs in the room too. For the amount that i paid for a family suite 600SGD plus or minus, i think that its overpriced and nothing to be wowed abt. For tourists, yes its a good location being that it is in the center of country n near Orchard Rd, but im sure u guys cud use the money and stay somewhr else that is worth the money. Anyways, Singapore is so small, it doesnt matter even if ur not staying in the heart of the city or the center of the country. Frm one end of the country to the other end it only take about 1 hr + to travel by train or at a lesser time by legitimate taxis/cabs. Venture out of the usual comfort zone and you'll be surprise by what other great hotels Singapore have got to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious”
Reviews.Author: ozkatie
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel to stay at with family, the rooms are very large, and very clean. We only stayed one night on our way to london so was proably a bit far from the airport. We stay there on our way back again but have the whole day to go shopping so it will be very convienent.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FashionPrima
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Rooms are well designed. The hotel is located in the shopping area so if you stay there bring with you credit cards.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have stayed at in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: FN2502
Reviews.Content: I have travelled over 20+ times to Singapore in the last 12 month and this was my first experiece at this hotel. It has a very good location but that is all it has..!! The rooms are adequate but very old and in need of updating. I had two rooms during my stay as the frst was a shambles. The Fridge was broken and the bed was like a concrete slab, both had leaking bathrooms, running water sounds all night long and the air conditioning was not working properly in the first one! When advised many times to the staff , nothing was done and it was "oh yes we have heard this before" we will look into it! Most hotels in SIngapore have freindly and helpfull staff, but not this one. They were arrogant and had not concept of customer services, especially given the hotel charge a ridculous rate for based purly on location! If you want a quiet, well run, comfortable hotel experince in Singapore DO NOT STAY at this over rated, over priced and poorly run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very tired”
Reviews.Author: DP72
Reviews.Content: I've just spent a couple of nights at the Orchard Parade and have to agree with the reviewer who says that location is the only thing it's got going for it. When I arrived at the hotel, none of the reception staff seemed interested in checking me in and carried on what they were doing. My deluxe room was ok, but nothing special. Bed was comfortable; TV old with broken remote control sensor which worked some of the time. The view from the balcony was of tv aerials and grotty buildings. The bathroom was tiny with ancient fittings. Toilet paper of the very economy kind. Pool average at best. I chose the Orchard Parade for its location because I couldn't get into the hotel of my choice Despite being well sited, I wouldn't choose it again.

Reviews.Title: “Old & Tired”
Reviews.Author: boogiebeat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just spent a few days there S$325 per night. I won't bore you with the details but we certainly won't be staying there again.The hotel is in dire need of a revamp and by revamp I mean rebuilding. Once bitten, twice shy.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be good, but....”
Reviews.Author: Hill7690
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on 7 or 8 occasions, always on business. It was good at first, with great location. However my last 2 trips have been very disappointing. I will not return! Even though I had stayed there on a number of occasions there was not an ounce of gratitude. I found the reception staff and management very unhelpful, the rooms need refurbishing (especially on the car park side), the bar is greatly overpriced, as is internet access. There is very little leeway for extended check out facility, in fact I was reduced to showering in the pool side cubicle on my last day after business and prior to heading for dinner then airport. I do not seek any great favours, but a little comfort and courtesy...? I would not recommend this hotel except for its location.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: JJB
Reviews.Content: We made a last minute booking and could only get hold of this one which offered twin room with extra bed at a very reasonable price (S$260). When we checked in (at around 11:45pm), we were greeted by a nice gentleman at the front desk and were given a very spacious triple room at no extra charge - nice beds, clean, high quality bedding and very quiet. Our room is on the 3rd floor, is facing a back street. We cannot hear anything from upstairs or the neighbourhood. This is the fourth time I visited Singapore and I find Orchard Parade a very nice stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: PIKAREA
Reviews.Content: Check-in: First imression, was a bad impression. Our rooms were wrong, and the reception made absolutely NO intention of righting the wrong. My husband is very large, and they wanted us to sleep in single beds, when we paid for the king bed. She insisted there was nothing they could do, so I asked if she could recommed a hotel that could accomodate me. She handed me a phone book and carried on wioth other business. I was shocked at hold cold she was! THEN...I asked if I paid more, could they accomodate me. Of course they could, money talks (why didnt she just say that in the first place?) We had to pay to upgrade to a room with a King (even though that is in fact what we paid for on-line) and priveledges to use the Business Center which included nightly cocktails and hordervs. Stuart Anderson: As we waited for our room, we decided to eat here for lunch, it was familiar. In the entire restraunt there was my husband & I, and 3 other families. Once our food came, we never saw the waitress again. She left for the day and nobody took her place to help us. Horrible service! Business Center: It was actually very nice and the staff in here was friendly. The most friendly in the entire hotel. We got to know some of the staff and they spilled the beans on "managment problems"...saying all staff is unhappy. Our room came with a cocktail hour..but the staff admitted they did not know how to make cocktails. When we asked for drinks, they had no idea what the liquors were called so they allowed to go to the back and pull the liquor ourselves. Only one computer worked the entire time we were there. Light breakfast was also included...not bad. Pool: Nice, quiet, and clean. However, 1 outdoor shower busted and water poured out for over an hour. We let them know, but it obviously wasnt a priority. Salon: At the time we were there, there were 2 salons. One had been located in the Hotel for years and owned by an older woman, the other was fairly new and more modern. I visited the older one...she too spilled her beans as to how horrible the managment has been to everyone. Bottom Line: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone nor would I ever return. The service was absolutely nothing they boast on their website. It was neither warm nor welcoming...it was cold! A lot of nice things to look at, but nothing much nice to say.

Reviews.Title: “good location and decent rooms.”
Reviews.Author: neversummer
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for 3 nights. Overall a good experience for the price. This is a solid 3 star business hotel i would say...has a decent pool, with gym. No jacuzzi,...i didnt check for steam room in the gym. The rooms are comfortable.. i had a superior room and a deluxe room due to a mix up. My view on either room was not great....basically, i was facing another building and away from the orchard rd. It the deluxe room (the lesser of the two) was the basic room size...had reasonable internet access....all the regular amenities with security box. ironing board and blowdryer. decent size tv...not flatscreen..and clean beds. the superior room was more spacious..maybe 30% more. Some have seperate shower and tub. others did not... had the usuals...shampoo, conditioner, soap, and a toothbrush. The only thing annoying is, theres only 1 elevator area..and if you so happen to be in the far end of the building...you will be walking thru a number to turns...so, if you can request for a room closer to the elevator, that would be ideal. Also, if you get a far room...which is i think in another building that was later connected...the floors heights between the 2 buildings somehow dont match...and you have to walk down a few steps along the way... no big deal if you are not strolling along luggage. But when you check out, it will be annoying... Main lobby is not very impressive...looks like a business hotel...no grand waiting area, or elegant restaurants... just basic stuff. It is next to starbucks which is a plus if you like starbucks... i personally dont...but some people do. As for breakfast..i didnt check what they had since my room didnt come with a breakfast. We opt to walk to the hotel across the street...i think it is the orchard hotel.....it had a great buffet breakfast. Nightlfe...well, there's the orchard towers... i dont think this is a place you'd take a date... i think it is accurately known as the 4 floors of whores. anyways...this is a business hotel....i dont think id shop here either since the best deals are somewhere else....clubs are somewhere else too....so, unless you have business in this area... this would be the place to be.

HotelInfo.Name: Orchard Parade Hotel by Far East Hospitality
HotelInfo.Address: 1 Tanglin Road, Singapore 247905, Singapore
